result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:48 AM Defendant Montrell T Hall appeared by video, in custody from Outagamie County Jail.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Montrell T Hall.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes we are set for a speedy trial. Defense is still on for trial. Bond continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:00 AM Defendant Montrell T Hall in court, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Montrell T Hall.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Sergeant Bryner sworn in and provides testimony. Court notes identification of defendant. Cross examination of Sergeant Bryner. State/Defense call no other witnesses. State/Defense speak to the case. Court finds probable cause for felony conduct, bound over for arraignment on an information.  Information filed.  Not guilty plea entered. Defense requests speedy trial. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Written proof to jail to live at 2811 Maange Ave; Apt A, LDF, No contact with Shauna Saglin, No possession illegal prescriptions or drugs

11:05 AM Defendant Montrell T Hall in court, in custody with the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett via video for Montrell T Hall.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges complaint. Waives further reading. Enter not guilty plea. Defense heard on bond. Court modifies bond to $300.00 cash. Conditions: Written proof to jail to live at 2811 Maange Ave; Apt A, LDF, No contact with Shauna Saglin, No possession illegal prescriptions or drugs. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:45 am.
